Package org.springcorebankapp.account

Class AccountService

java.lang.Object
org.springcorebankapp.account.AccountService
@Service @Transactional public class AccountService extends Object
Service class for managing bank accounts.

This class provides business logic for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting accounts, as well as performing operations such as deposits, withdrawals, and transfers. It interacts with the AccountRepository, UserRepository, and AccountProperties to handle persistence, validation, and application-specific configurations.

Key Features:

  • Account creation with default balances.
  • Retrieval of accounts by ID or user ID, with caching support.
  • Deposit, withdrawal, and transfer functionality with validation and caching.
  • Account closure logic, ensuring rules are followed before deletion.

Methods use annotations such as Cacheable and CacheEvict for caching account-related data, improving application performance.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      @CacheEvict(value="accounts", key="#login") public Account createAccount(String login)
      Creates a new account for a user with a default balance.
      Parameters:
      login - the username of the user for whom the account is to be created
      Returns:
      the created Account entity
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no user is found with the provided login

    • findAccountById

      @Cacheable(value="accounts", key="#id") public Account findAccountById(int id) throws AccountNotFoundException
      Finds an account by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the account to retrieve
      Returns:
      the found Account entity
      Throws:
      AccountNotFoundException - if no account is found with the provided ID

    • getAllUserAccounts

      @Cacheable(value="userAccounts", key="#userId") public List<Account> getAllUserAccounts(int userId)
      Retrieves all accounts associated with a specific user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user
      Returns:
      a list of Account entities owned by the user
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if no accounts are found for the user

    • depositAccount

      @CacheEvict(value="accounts", key="#accountId") public void depositAccount(int accountId, int moneyToDeposit) throws AccountNotFoundException
      Deposits money into a specific account.
      Parameters:
      accountId - the ID of the account to deposit money into
      moneyToDeposit - the amount of money to deposit
      Throws:
      AccountNotFoundException - if the account is not found
      IllegalArgumentException - if the deposit amount is not positive

    • withdrawFromAccount

      @CacheEvict(value="accounts", key="#accountId") public void withdrawFromAccount(int accountId, int amountToWithdraw) throws AccountNotFoundException
      Withdraws money from a specific account.
      Parameters:
      accountId - the ID of the account to withdraw money from
      amountToWithdraw - the amount of money to withdraw
      Throws:
      AccountNotFoundException - if the account is not found
      IllegalArgumentException - if the withdrawal amount is not positive or exceeds the account's balance

    • closeAccount

      @CacheEvict(value={"accounts","userAccounts"}, allEntries=true) public void closeAccount(int accountId) throws AccountNotFoundException
      Closes a specific account, transferring its balance to another account if necessary.

      This method ensures that a user cannot close their only account. If the account has a balance, the funds are transferred to another account owned by the same user. The account is then removed from the system.

      Parameters:
      accountId - the ID of the account to be closed
      Throws:
      AccountNotFoundException - if the account is not found
      IllegalArgumentException - if the user only has one account, preventing closure

    • transfer

      @CacheEvict(value="accounts", allEntries=true) public void transfer(int fromAccountId, int toAccountId, int amountToTransfer) throws AccountNotFoundException
      Transfers money from one account to another.

      This method allows transferring funds between two accounts, either within the same user or between different users. If the transfer is between accounts of different users, a commission is applied to the amount being transferred. Both accounts' balances are updated accordingly, and changes are saved to the database.

      Parameters:
      fromAccountId - the ID of the account to transfer money from
      toAccountId - the ID of the account to transfer money to
      amountToTransfer - the amount of money to transfer
      Throws:
      AccountNotFoundException - if either of the accounts is not found
      IllegalArgumentException - if the transfer amount is not positive or if the source account's balance is insufficient
